data.title: Lin Zexu Memorial Museum of Macau
data.text:
Museum in Nossa Senhora de Fátima, Macau, China

Lin Zexu Memorial Museum of MacauChinese nameTraditional Chinese澳門林則徐紀念館Simplified Chinese澳门林则徐纪念馆

TranscriptionsStandard MandarinHanyu PinyinÀomén Lín Zéxú JìniànguǎnYue: CantoneseJyutpingou3 mun4*2 lam4 zak1 ceoi4 gei2 nim6 gun2

Portuguese namePortugueseMuseu Lin Zexu de Macau

The Lin Zexu Memorial Museum of Macau (Chinese: 澳門林則徐紀念館; Portuguese: Museu Lin Zexu de Macau) is a museum in Nossa Senhora de Fátima, Macau, China about Lin Zexu's arrival in Macau on 3 September 1839.

History

[edit]

The museum was completed in November 1997.[1] In June 2017, the museum became part of the area where the Macau International Industrial Technology Development Association launched a Wi-Fi hotspot.[2]

Architecture

[edit]

The museum features the statue of Lin Zexu at its entrance with a height of 4 metres (13 ft). The museum exhibition areas consists of Ban on Opium Trade and Inspection of Macao, Everlasting Memorials, Eyes Opened to the World and Macao before the Inspection Tour.[1]

Exhibitions

[edit]

The museum exhibits various photography of history during Lin Zexu period.[3][4]
